intro: Exomis microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved exomis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the wet season. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems and is adapted to thrive in humid, well-drained soils.
